title: Just Cause

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Thank you for coming today, everyone. I am in your debt...all of you. The king of Gallia, Caineghis. The king of Phoenicis, Tibarn. The Serenes Royal Family, Rafiel and Reyson. And the queen of Crimea, Elincia, who worked tirelessly to arrange this meeting and generously extended her hospitality. She gave me hope when I was driven out of my country, and offered aid when all seemed lost. You have my sincere gratitude.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Before we begin, allow me to make a few things clear about the recent war between Begnion and the Laguz Alliance. When we received your letter stating that the senate had made scapegoats of the herons for the previous apostle's assassination, Prime Minister Sephiran and I decided to investigate the senate and prosecute them if needed. Then the senators made their move.

intro.speaker: Caineghis
intro.line: What did they do?

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: They imprisoned me in a room in the Mainal Cathedral. They then forged an arrest warrant for Sephiran and jailed him. ...I admit there had been major rifts between myself and the senators in the past. However, I had no idea that they would stoop to such deplorable acts. I should have known. This is all my fault.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: We didn't think you were behind all this war-mongering. What you just told us confirms what we had guessed.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: I have been forced to flee my country, but that doesn't change the fact that I am the empress of Begnion. I will not allow the senate to declare me false, nor will I stand by as they seize and ravage Begnion. I must return to my country, save my people, and take back my birthright. To accomplish all this, I would like to form an alliance with the laguz tribes. Help me save Begnion.

intro.speaker: Caineghis
intro.line: I will accept, if you agree to a few conditions. First, the immediate and total emancipation of any laguz remaining in slavery. Second, that new diplomatic relations between our peoples start with a clean slate; no bias against beorc or laguz shall be tolerated. Lastly, a full alliance between our countries, to further solidify this agreement. If you agree to these terms, I give my support. I hope that a long last the dream that both King Ramon and I held can come to fruition.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I agree with King Caineghis completely. If these conditions are agreed to, Crimea would like to join this alliance as well.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Do you intend to return the Serenes Forest to the herons when you take back the throne?

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Of course. The goddess loved the forest because the herons made their homes there. I will see to it that you can return home.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: My brother! We can finally go home! Our family can be together again, in our own homeland, for the first time in decades...

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: All right. I'm all for this. I didn't need much convincing, though. I just want to rip those idiots senators in half.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Gallia, Phoenicis, Serenes, and Crimea shall hereby make a pledge. Apostle Sanaki, we will wholeheartedly support your effort tot return to the throne, so long as we stand united in our ideals. Please bring peace back to our lands.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Each of you has my deepest gratitude. I will accomplish that goal.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So, it sounds like everyone is on the same side now. That's the best news I've heard in a long time.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: I feel the same, but it's too early to celebrate. I will not be happy until I take back my country. How we fare in the battles to come will be of the utmost importance.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: The Greil Mercenaries would be glad to help. I know that we're a small unit, but we'll do our best to see the job done right.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: I certainly hope you will. Especially since I've decided to make you the commander of our combined forces.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Wait, hold on there! What did you say?! Listen, Apostle Sanaki, I'm really flattered, but General Zelgius is much more qual--

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Zelgius returned to the empire by himself to rescue Prime Minister Sephiran. Our army consists of the troops he left behind, as well as the armies of Crimea, Gallia, and Phoenicis. Ike, you're probably the only person on the face of Tellius who commands respect from all four countries represented here.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Ike, I know you're not happy about this, but you're the only person who can bridge the rift between the laguz and beorc.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: No, I'm not happy about it. I thought my days of being a general ended three years ago. But I won't refuse. If you think I'm the only person who can pull this off, then I'll do my best not to let you down.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Thank you, Ike. Let us go meet with the armies and the soldiers you will be leading. They will want to meet their new commander.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Not again...

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: It is time to get moving. Do we have a target?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: First, we'll head for Flaguerre, the fortress town between Crimea and Begnion. Since the Laguz Alliance has fought in Flaguerre already, we're familiar with the lay of the land.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Sounds like a good plan. Do you still resent your choice to command this army?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: No offense, Apostle, but you didn't give me much of a choice in the first place. Besides, if I'm not fully committed, how can I expect these troops to be? Just remember: when this is all over, you'll be getting one heck of a bill.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Oh, I'm sure, and I know you'll be worth it. Speaking of which, I have something for you. Consider it a down payment.

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: I'm sure you remember this blade. It is the holy sword Ragnell. Please take it.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Are you sure about this? I returned it after the Mad King's War because you said it was one of Begnion's national treasures.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Indeed. This sword was used by Empress Altina, the first apostle of Begnion, back in the early days of the empire. It was one of the two swords the empress used to fight the dark god. I can think of no better person to give it to.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: All right. I'd be happy to use it again. Thanks.

intro.speaker: Crimea
intro.line: Excuse me! I bring urgent news to Queen Elincia and General Ike of the apostle's army!

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: What happened?!

intro.speaker: Crimea
intro.line: We've received a report that the Daein army has appeared near the border between Daein and Crimea! The Daein army demands custody of the apostle on behalf of Begnion! They will use force if necessary.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Daein wants to get in our hair again? Perfect.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: ...I am puzzled by this. Why does Daein support the senate? Well, I suppose it doesn't matter. Ike, we must change our target.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Agreed. We have to get Daein out of our way before we do anything else.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: So, Daein still refuses to negotiate?

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: Either they believe the senate's lies, or...the senate is pulling some strings behind the scenes.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Well, whatever the reason, we can't attack Begnion without taking care of this first.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: I will not give up. I won't stop sending messengers until they respond. Ike, I leave you in charge here.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Let's keep our numbers small. We shouldn't provoke them any further.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: I understand. Gallia will stay behind.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You'll have your turn soon, Skrimir. I promise. All right, let's go!

battle.speaker: Goran
battle.line: I cannot believe this! It's an army of sub-humans and beorc. It must be true that this apostle is a fake. The true apostle would never join forces with those filthy creatures!

battle.speaker: Daein
battle.line: The enemy has sent a messenger once again. Commander, this is the third time they've asked to negotiate.

battle.speaker: Goran
battle.line: Ignore the messengers! We must protect this bridge. That is the order from the Maiden of Dawn!

battle.speaker: Tibarn
battle.line: Hey, sorry to keep you waiting. I had a little thing back at camp that I had to deal with.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: No problem, Tibarn. What kind of thing? Oh, and hey, where's Reyson?

battle.speaker: Tibarn
battle.line: He was exhausted, but he insisted on coming with me. I had to tie him down to a bed to keep him there.

battle.speaker: Tibarn
battle.line: Nah, I'm just kidding. He passed out earlier. So I have a different anchor slowing me down this time.

battle.speaker: Leanne
battle.line: Tibarn! You're horrible! I am not an anchor!

battle.speaker: Tibarn
battle.line: She's Reyson's sister, for sure. The girl is as stubborn as he his! Listen up, young lady. You herons are supposed to be more like Rafiel. Quiet and graceful and all that.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Don't mind Tibarn, Leanne. We're honored to have you here.

boss.speaker: Goran
boss.line: Followers of the false apostle! Bow down to the miracles of our savior! As long as the Maiden of Dawn watches over us, we cannot be defeated!

boss.speaker: Goran
boss.line: My death means nothing... The Maiden of Dawn...will bring victory...to Daein.

boss.speaker: Goran
boss.line: Your troops fought bravely. I commend your effort.

boss.speaker: Ike
boss.line: But your force has been obliterated. I order you to retreat. Continue this fight and you will die.

boss.speaker: Goran
boss.line: Fool, the battle is not over yet! The Maiden of Dawn has helped us overcome every adversity...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: The Daein army is much stronger than it was three years ago.

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: Yes, by far. Even after the situation turned against them, every soldier fought with valor. Quite impressive.

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: They kept muttering about the power of their general, this "Maiden of Dawn." The soldiers seem obsessed with her.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: This might sound strange, but think of it like this: they believe in her as much as you Holy Knights believe in the apostle.

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: Hmph, I understand. They are formidable and deluded, then. I shall use caution.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Micaiah, it's over. The front line is broken. The apostle's army is crossing the bridge.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: All right, then.. Order a retreat.

end.speaker: Inspector
end.line: Wh-what?! No! Are you a simpleton? Just destroy the bridge!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Inspector... With all due respect, Daein soldiers will also die if we destroy the bridge now.

end.speaker: Inspector
end.line: Those are called acceptable losses, my dear, and any losses suffered by your men are acceptable if it means stopping that army! As a representative of the senate, I will not allow you to retreat! Fight to the last man!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Inspector. While I respect your opinion... The final decision is up to me, as commander in chief of this army. Sothe, order the retreat. Get those men out of there before they're routed.

end.speaker: Inspector
end.line: Insolent little brat! How dare you disobey my orders!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: We could always leave you here while the rest of us retreat, Inspector. How's that sound?

end.speaker: Inspector
end.line: Y-you... I will report this incident to both your king and the senate! Start thinking of an excuse now, perhaps!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Pompous fool...

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Well, I'll go order the retreat.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Micaiah?!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I...I'm sorry, I...

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Don't move. I'll be right back!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: What's happening? I was doing so well...for a while... I feel like...fog is clouding my mind... Am I...losing my powers?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Funny... I always wished that I didn't have this farsight... It often feels like such a burden... But this clouded vision seems so strange. Now, I miss the clarity... Ironic, isn't it, Yune?

end.speaker: Nailah
end.line: What's wrong, Rafiel?

end.speaker: Rafiel
end.line: I sensed something...strange. It just came out of the blue. It was some sort of voice...

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: My brother, did you call me?

end.speaker: Rafiel
end.line: I did not. You heard it too, Reyson?

end.speaker: Nailah
end.line: What's going on here? What was that voice?

end.speaker: Rafiel
end.line: I don't know, but it's calling for us. The voice was coming from the northeast... From the direction of Daein.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: I have a bad feeling about this. Let us head for Daein. Please prepare to leave immediately. I will speak with King Caineghis and get permission to leave.

end.speaker: Nailah
end.line: I hope nothing has happened to your sister.

end.speaker: Rafiel
end.line: As do I... All I know is that I must go there. That much is certain.

narration: Apostle Sanaki's army, with Ike at its head, wins a great victory over Daein at Oribes Bridge. However, Apostle Sanaki elects not to pursue the retreating Daein forces. Instead, she petitions King Pelleas for permission to pass through Daein.
After waiting for several days, she receives no reply, and Sanaki reluctantly orders a march. Avoiding the heart of Daein, the army skirts along the mountains and makes its way south.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I'm here. What do you want?

conversation.speaker: Sanaki
conversation.line: Hmph. Don't look so sour.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I always look like this, Apostle Sanaki.

conversation.speaker: Sanaki
conversation.line: Ah, yes. That's true. Well, I didn't summon you to talk about your grumpy expressions. I wanted to give you something before we set off for battle.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What is it?

conversation.speaker: Sanaki
conversation.line: Do you know what this is?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Not a clue.

conversation.speaker: Sanaki
conversation.line: When I fled the cathedral, I took some valuables with me. This is called a master crown. It's said to release a beorc's hidden power.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I've never heard of it.

conversation.speaker: Sanaki
conversation.line: Not everyone can use it, so think before you pass it on to someone.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: All right, I'll take it. Thank you.

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: General Ike. Thank you for helping the apostle. I appreciate it from the bottom of my heart.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I would have refused, if I'd known that I'd be commanding the entire army.

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: That's why we didn't tell you beforehand.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: That's a pretty devious move, Sigrun.

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: Here are some funds, so you can properly prepare for the upcoming battle. Show us how you've grown since the days of the Mad King's War, General.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: Rahh! Hyahh! Hahh!

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: Hiyah! Umph! Hahh!

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: You really push yourself in training, don't you, Kieran?

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: Huh!? Ah, Oscar! You snuck up on me! Only a true rival of mine could accomplish such a feat!

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: I've been watching for half an hour.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: What!? Then why didn't you say hello? And I would have expected better manners!

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: I did. You didn't notice.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: Ah, yes! My concentration while training is unbreakable! No one can distract me!

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: Hmm. I wonder if he realizes that he contradicts everything he says.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: What was that!? If you have something to say, let it out! Speak like a man! Stand tall!

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: Yes, yes. Whatever you say. Here, I got this for you.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: What is this?

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: This is an Imbue scroll. Imbue is a skill you should learn, especially since you always train until you're soaked in your own blood.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: I've never heard of such a skill. Is it special?

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: Oh, yes. It's very special.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: Why would you give such a precious thing to me?!

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: Well, um... I just told you.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: I cannot accept it! I accept no charity from rivals!

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: Why do you have to be like this?

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: We are equals. I need no favors from you! Run along, now.

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: Sigh.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: I don't have the time to talk to you. I'm too busy training! Go on, leave!

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: Ahem... It was meant as a symbol of friendship for my lifelong rival.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: What?!

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: But I guess if you won't accept it, I'll find someone else who will.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: Wait! I'll take it.

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: You'd swallow your own words?

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: Ugh! Never! However... I note that your lifelong rival is me, and no one else! If your gift will mark me as your lifelong rival, I must have it!

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: That's what I like about you, Sir Simpleton.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: You insult me!?

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: No, that was a compliment. You're a very...simple...knight. Living only for battle and whatnot.

conversation.speaker: Kieran
conversation.line: Great! Thanks!

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: Life is boring without you, Kieran.
